publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-333# Dr Elaine Murray: Macmillan Cancer Relief's World's Biggest Coffee Morning-That the Parliament notes that Macmillan Cancer Relief will hold its annual World's Biggest Coffee Morning on 26 September 2003; congratulates it for raising £3.2 million in a single morning last year; notes its goal to raise £3.5 million this year; encourages members to support local efforts, and congratulates Macmillan Cancer Relief on the excellent services it provides to cancer sufferers and their relatives in the form of expert care, practical advice and support and the funding of treatment facilities. Supported by: Mrs Nanette Milne*

S2M-333# Macmillan Cancer Relief's World's Biggest Coffee Morning (lodged on 10 September 2003) Mary Scanlon*, Eleanor Scott*, Margaret Jamieson*, Marlyn Glen*, Sarah Boyack*, David Mundell*, Robert Brown*, Mr John Home Robertson*, Phil Gallie*, Dr Sylvia Jackson*, Jackie Baillie*, Ms Wendy Alexander*, Ms Sandra White*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Mr Keith Raffan*, Christine May*, Karen Whitefield*, Mr Ted Brocklebank*, Fergus Ewing*, Mike Pringle*, Cathie Craigie*, Rosie Kane*, Pauline McNeill*, Mike Watson*, Johann Lamont*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Mrs Margaret Smith*, Helen Eadie*, Alex Fergusson*, Frances Curran*, Karen Gillon*, Carolyn Leckie*, Maureen Macmillan*, Margo MacDonald*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*, Mr David Davidson*, Bill Butler*, Elaine Smith*, Fiona Hyslop*

S2M-333# Dr Elaine Murray: Macmillan Cancer Relief's World's Biggest Coffee Morning—That the Parliament notes that Macmillan Cancer Relief will hold its annual World's Biggest Coffee Morning on 26 September 2003; congratulates it for raising £3.2 million in a single morning last year; notes its goal to raise £3.5 million this year; encourages members to support local efforts, and congratulates Macmillan Cancer Relief on the excellent services it provides to cancer sufferers and their relatives in the form of expert care, practical advice and support and the funding of treatment facilities. Supported by: Mrs Nanette Milne, Mary Scanlon, Eleanor Scott, Margaret Jamieson, Marlyn Glen, Sarah Boyack, David Mundell, Robert Brown, Mr John Home Robertson, Phil Gallie, Dr Sylvia Jackson, Jackie Baillie, Ms Wendy Alexander, Ms Sandra White, Roseanna Cunningham, Mr Keith Raffan, Christine May, Karen Whitefield, Mr Ted Brocklebank, Fergus Ewing, Mike Pringle, Cathie Craigie, Rosie Kane, Pauline McNeill, Mike Watson, Johann Lamont, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Mr Stewart Maxwell, Mrs Margaret Smith, Helen Eadie, Alex Fergusson, Frances Curran, Karen Gillon, Carolyn Leckie, Maureen Macmillan, Margo MacDonald, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Mr David Davidson, Bill Butler, Elaine Smith, Fiona Hyslop, Cathy Peattie*, Susan Deacon*, Shiona Baird*, Nora Radcliffe*, Dr Jean Turner*, Kate Maclean*
S2M-333# Macmillan Cancer Relief's World's Biggest Coffee Morning (lodged on 10 September 2003) Mr Jamie Stone*, Rhona Brankin*, Christine Grahame*, Tommy Sheridan*, Donald Gorrie*
S2M-333# Macmillan Cancer Relief's World's Biggest Coffee Morning (lodged on 10 September 2003) John Swinburne*, Trish Godman*
S2M-333# Macmillan Cancer Relief's World's Biggest Coffee Morning (lodged on 10 September 2003) Michael McMahon*, Janis Hughes*, Irene Oldfather*
